posts.name: ori
posts.cooked:
In our competition it happened to us twice when we were the closest driver station to the source, an opponent robot hit the driver station hard and the computer froze, we used hook and loop strips on our computer.

Had it happent to anyone else?
Yes, team 2630 has had issues with driver station disconnects.

posts.name: Gus Michel II
posts.cooked: About all you can do is ensure you are using cables with robust retaining clips, and thatâ€™s likely a mitigation, not a remedy.

posts.name: Dan_Karol
posts.cooked:
there is probably a hardware defect in the Laptop that causes a cable or component on the board to have a transient short or disconnect when under high G-loading.  I recommend looking into a different laptop to use as the DS.

There are some laptops that are hardened to impacts, but that is probably not necessary.

posts.name: JamesCH95
posts.cooked: Ensure Youâ€™re not using a laptop with a spinning HDD, they are the computer component most susceptible to impacts.

We (2648) had this happen at Pine Tree too. First time I have personally seen it happen. Our drive station was near the amp and an alliance member hit the wall causing the computer to reboot (yes we had velcro on the driver station). No HDDs in this laptop too.
